answers.answer: Hi there.  I think that is a good question for your next doctor's visit.  Sometimes we have our conception date off.  At least that is what they say----  they tried to tell me that mine was off with my first baby and like I KNOW when I conceived because I was trying and tracked my temp to know when I'd finished ovulation and got a positive test 4 days before my next period.  Anyway (sorry, I got side tracked)---  I think it will mostly come into play with your delivery.  Big babies are a little harder to deliver.  You've had all of your gestational diabetes tests at this point, right?  So, it will most likely affect that if anything.I was induced with my second child because they said he was big.good luck
Yea I've had the test done it came out fine. I was just trying to make sure I have Nothing to worry about. Thank you for your advice

My Dr says that it's normal for babies to havea major growth spurt between 28-32 weeks. mine jumped 4 weeks between 30 and 31 weeks. It's just an estimate, but usually the growth will average out. So, for now, don't stress. Talk with your Dr.

question: For my past 4 appointments my doctor has said I'm measuring big, as of today I'm 28 weeks & 3 days I'm measuring 34 also as of today. I know everyone's pregnancy is different but being a ftm I'm just curious if this is something I should worry about, is this happening to anyone else & has it happened to anyone else?
title: measuring big
